content.description: Sit start with a right hand gaston and a left hand sidepull. From there, climb straight up through a series of sidepulls, gastons, and edges to reach a pair of big pinches at the lip, then follow to the bumps and jugs up high to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Squeezebox.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched in the hueco, and climb straight up using an assortment of pockets and edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two will work. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Squeezebox.

content.description:
Stand start with a right hand edge and a left hand pocket. From there, place a high left heel hook, reach a right hand sidepull, bump the left hand up to the pocket above, stick the lip, and pull on top.

A sit start is possible and the movement is nice, but I imagine the start hold won't last long.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has several rocks.
content.location: It climbs the east face overhang.

content.description: Sit sit matched on a sidepull feature with feet on the opposing boulder across the crack. From there, work the hands up the arete, reach the jug at the lip, and mantel atop the boulder (I ended up stemming with the other boulder to avoid a possible fall on the boulder in the landing).
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is shared with a large boulder.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Squeezebox, on the south half of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a high right hand pinch and a left hand compressing the arete. From there, work the left hand up the arete while working the right hand up to the jugs above, and mantel atop.
content.protection: Pads. The landing is good unless you pitch off the back into a tree.
content.location: It climbs the east face, the north half of the boulder.
